questions.question:
Let \(P_1, P_2,\dots , P_n\) be n points in the xy-plane such that no three of them are collinear. For every pair of points \(P_i\) and \(P_j\), let \(L_{ij}\) be the line passing through them. Let \(L_{ab}\) be the line with the steepest gradient among all \(n(n -1)/2\) lines.
The time complexity of the best algorithm for finding \(P_a\) and \(P_b\) is

(GATE IT 2007)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Let \(P_1, P_2,\dots , P_n\) be n points in the xy-plane such that no three of them are collinear. For every pair of points \(P_i\) and \(P_j\), let \(L_{ij}\) be the line passing through them. Let \(L_{ab}\) be the line with the steepest gradient among all \(n(n -1)/2\) lines.
Which one of the following properties should necessarily be satisfied ?

(GATE IT 2007)
options:
A.

\(P_{a}\) and \(P_{b}\) are adjacent to each other with respect to their x-coordinate

B.

Either \(P_{a}\) or \(P_{b}\) has the largest or the smallest y-coordinate among all the points

C.

The difference between x-coordinates \(P_{a}\) and \(P_{b}\) is minimum
questions.correct_answer:
A.

\(P_{a}\) and \(P_{b}\) are adjacent to each other with respect to their x-coordinate

questions.question:

i. \(10^{-2}\)
ii. \(10^{-3}\)
iii. \(10^{-4}\)
iv. \(10^{-5}\)
For which of these values of the step size h, is the computed value guaranteed to be correct to seven decimal places. Assume that there are no round-off errors in the computation.

(GATE IT 2007)

questions.question:
Consider the set of (column) vectors defined by
\(X=\{x\in R^{3}|x_{1}+x_{2}+x_{3}=0, \; where \; x^{T}=[x_{1},x_{2},x_{3}]^{T}\}.\)
Which of the following is TRUE?

(GATE CSE 2007)
options:
A.

\(\{[1,-1,0]^{T},[1,0,-1]^{T}\}\) is a basis for the subspace X.

B.

\(\{[1,-1,0]^{T},[1,0,-1]^{T}\}\) is a linearly independent set, but it does not span X and therefore is not a basis of X.
questions.correct_answer:
A.

\(\{[1,-1,0]^{T},[1,0,-1]^{T}\}\) is a basis for the subspace X.
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the following two statements about the function f(x)=|x|:

P. f(x) is continuous for all real values of x
Q. f(x) is differentiable for all real values of x

Which of the following is TRUE?

(GATE CSE 2007)
options:
A.

P is true and Q is false.

B.

P is false and Q is true.
questions.correct_answer:
A.

P is true and Q is false.

\(\begin{array}{|l|l|l|l|} \hline & \text { Method } & & \text { Order of Convergence } \\ \hline \text { 1. } & \text { Bisection } & \text { P. } & \text { 2 or more } \\ \hline \text { 2. } & \text { Newton-Raphson } & \text { Q. } & 1.62 \\ \hline \text { 3. } & \text { Secant } & \text { R. } & 1 \\ \hline \text { 4. } & \text { Regula falsi } & \text { S. } & 1 \text { bit per iteration } \\ \hline \end{array}\)
